page.title: 09SHELVES CLO.CHTY, CULMSTOCK
page.content:
SHELVES CLOSE CHARITY comes under the control of the Charity Commissioners.
From donations made by various benefactors, at different times, SHELVES CLOSE, a field of about 3 1/4 acres at PRESCOTT, was bought about 1794 for the sum of Â£150.
The land was let as allotments and the income used to give eight old men and women in the Parish a sum of money at Christmas.
This land is still let and the eight oldest still receive their gift at Christmas each year.
The Charity is administered by two Trustees appointed by the Parish Council and three others co-opted.
